resources.string: A potentially terrifying aspect of this archetype manifests itself whenever karmic mood swings wipe out our plans, like a storm that has come upon us.
Freedom from inner conflicts, and so clear a channel, that the buried talents and gifts of past incarnations can come through an individual in this lifetime.
The wild and passion of our instinctive nature does not need to be broken, but refined and brought to consciousness, so that all levels of creation may come into harmony.
The choice of evolution over perfection, or the choice of personal growth through relationships-rather than a fantasy in which everything falls perfectly into place and is taken care of effortlessly.
Reminds us to recognize the path of personal development within ourselves — and the stage upon that path where we find ourselves — in order to energize our movement toward deeper self-realization.
Visualize yourself manifesting something unique, guided by evolutionary forces that emerge spontaneously from within your soul.
This card points to a time of harvest, symbolized in classical decks by the reaping skeleton. Unless the fruits of summer are harvested, they are lost to winters harshness, and the people do not eat.

Human incarnation of the divine. When two humans are shown, the image is portraying a resolution of the tension between opposites at all levels. Its as if this card is saying "You can do no wrong — its all to the good!"
There is danger in this feeling of freedom, because of the increased rate of change and its power to magnify mistakes in judgment.
